title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for describing hilly or mountainous landscapes.

Two points for accurately describing the terrain in Image 2 as hills or mountains that have been modified by terracing.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following aspects of the topography shown in Image 2:
The response correctly states one of the following aspects of the topography shown in Image 2:
The response correctly describes the following aspect of the topography shown in Image 2:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that natural vegetation was replaced with circular patterns.

Two points for explaining that center pivot irrigation systems replaced natural vegetation with circular patterns or replaced rangeland with cropland.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how the land use practice shown in Image 1 resulted in land cover change:
The response correctly states one of the following ways how the land use practice shown in Image 1 resulted in land cover change:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how the land use practice shown in Image 1 resulted in land cover change:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that terraces transform hills into farmable/arable land.

Two points for explaining how societies benefit from efficient uses of land for farming and water resources.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following positive effects that terracing may have on a rural society:
The response correctly states one of the following positive effects that terracing may have on a rural society:
The response correctly explains one of the following positive effects that terracing may have on a rural society:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that mechanized irrigation increases carrying capacity and increases crop production.

Two points for explaining how mechanized irrigation efficiently improves carrying capacity, with some negative effects.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which mechanized irrigation has increased the carrying capacity of land used for agriculture:
The response correctly states the following degree to which mechanized irrigation has increased the carrying capacity of land used for agriculture:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which mechanized irrigation has increased the carrying capacity of land used for agriculture:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that subsidies may help farmers in more developed countries compete.

Two points for explaining mechanisms and policies governments may use to address differences and disparities in market access between farmers in more developed and less developed countries.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways how government policies may allow farmers in developed countries to compete with imported crops from developing countries:
The response correctly states the following way how government policies may allow farmers in developed countries to compete with imported crops from developing countries:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways how government policies may allow farmers in developed countries to compete with imported crops from developing countries:
